alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 5:11PM MDT until August 04 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Fremont County in central Colorado... * Until 815 PM MDT. * At 511 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Far southern portions of the Canon City area. This includes the following streams and drainages... Arkansas River, Grape Creek, South Oak Creek, South Newlin Creek, Mineral Creek, Chandler Creek, Texas Creek, Sandy Creek, Oak Creek, Copper Gulch and Newlin Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
